thread.title: TRAFFIC WARNING: Rush hour chaos after lorry smashes through bridge
thread.title_full: TRAFFIC WARNING: Rush hour chaos after lorry smashes through bridge

title: TRAFFIC WARNING: Rush hour chaos after lorry smashes through bridge
text:
TRAFFIC WARNING: Rush hour chaos after lorry smashes through bridge TRAFFIC WARNING: Rush hour chaos after lorry smashes through bridge A HORROR accident which caused major delays overnight is continuing to cause disruption this morning after a lorry plunged off a bridge onto the road below. PUBLISHED: 07:52, Thu, Feb 9, 2017 | UPDATED: 08:11, Thu, Feb 9, 2017 ALAMY LIVE/ EAST NEWS Major delays after horror lorry crash on A12 between junction 25 and junction 19 
Dramatic pictures have emerged of the smash on the A12 southbound in Witham, Essex. 
Police surrounded the scene last night where the lorry crashed through the barriers of Coleman’s Bridge and burst into flames on the southbound carriageway. 
Despite emergency services being able to slowly divert drivers from the area during last night’s rush hour the accident is still causing problems this morning. 
Officers said last night the scene, between Marks Tey (junction 25) and Boreham interchange (junction 19) would be closed until noon on Thursday. East News Lorry crashes through A12 bridge sparking major emergency services response 
The investigation into the accident has been described as “complex” by Essex police. 
Fire crews, ambulances and Essex police surrounded the scene last night as traffic queued along the A12. 
“Once the investigation has concluded Highways England will carry out any repairs and complete the recovery of the vehicle,” a statement from Highways England said. 
“The road will be opened as soon as it is safe to do so.” 
Traffic is being diverted via the A120, the A131, the A130 and back on to the A12. Road users intending on using the A12 southbound carriageway are advised to allow additional time for their journeys. Related articles
